channel.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED
channel.description:
Hey, since it is 1.5 months ago i released v1.0, I thought i should create V2.0, so here it is.
Features: *148 KB client class *Java files 599 KB (Regular Delta's are 1MB+) *Different packet handling *Flour Making *Pickables *Prayer *Amulet stringing, gem cutting and wool spinning *More accurate max hit formula *Attack lag fix *Task System *Music System *Converted the following into events: Dying, shopping, banking, skull timer, teleporting, picking up items from ground. (probably forgot some) *Clipping system (NPC clipping is already done for you) *Boat Travelling *Better way of handling food (Every F2P food works, P2P food can be very easely added) *Most ladders work (New ladders can be added very easely) *Combining + drinking Strength potions *HP saves when logging out (your hp doesn't go back to your max everytime you relog anymore) *Running bug fixed (if your out of run energy the run button kept enabled) *No mass saving anymore (Every player online gets saved at a different time, so theres no mass save anymore) *Every F2P shop works *Server is packaged *Alot more
[size=14pt]2.1:[/size] *Fixed a null pointer caused by first clicking items *Fixed noted items not getting unnoted when banked. *Changed that most of the classes needed to get referenced by client class (done by static access now)
Pictures: (Some are from v1) [img]http://i41.tinypic.com/359xteo.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/jRja9.png[/img] [img]http://i45.tinypic.com/2j61i1j.png[/img] [img]http://i45.tinypic.com/2gwrx2x.png[/img] [img]http://i49.tinypic.com/jfewb5.png[/img]
[img]http://i49.tinypic.com/2w7pp2q.png[/img] [img]http://i47.tinypic.com/28wfmzt.png[/img] [img]http://i50.tinypic.com/rjhxly.png[/img] [img]http://i45.tinypic.com/34zzk9z.png[/img]
Download:
Server: [url=http://up.ht/P2z6C9]http://up.ht/P2z6C9[/url] Mirror: [url=http://www.2shared.com/file/7diHHHiy/Delta_Cleaned_20.html]http://www.2shared.com/file/7diHHHiy/Delta_Cleaned_20.html[/url]
Server V2.1 download: [url=http://up.ht/LLt0ls]http://up.ht/LLt0ls[/url]
Client (cache downloads automaticly): [url=http://up.ht/NP87r9]http://up.ht/NP87r9[/url] Mirror: [url=http://www.2shared.com/file/CCfI4W4n/RuneScape_client.html]http://www.2shared.com/file/CCfI4W4n/RuneScape_client.html[/url]

item.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:24, topic:450887”]I’m just talking methods that have a specific call to the client / player classes.

You don’t have to make literally everything static. (i.e: variables, getters. etc.) You can still access the class by an instance. (to get getters, public variables, etc)

private static Class instance;

public static Class getInstance() {
    if (instance == null) {
        instance = new Class();
    }
    return instance;
}

or a method similar to the one you have. Were just creating the class (but not referencing the class by everyone)

[code=java]
private static final Class class = new Class();

public static Class getClass() {
return class;
}[/code]

Note: The accessor for the second doesn’t have to be static.[/quote]

Thanks for this

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I’m just talking methods that have a specific call to the client / player classes.

You don’t have to make literally everything static. (i.e: variables, getters. etc.) You can still access the class by an instance. (to get getters, public variables, etc)

private static Class instance;

public static Class getInstance() {
    if (instance == null) {
        instance = new Class();
    }
    return instance;
}

or a method similar to the one you have. Were just creating the class (but not referencing the class by everyone)

[code=java]
private static final Class class = new Class();

public static Class getClass() {
return class;
}[/code]

Note: The accessor for the second doesn’t have to be static.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:22, topic:450887”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=553762.msg4060965#msg4060965 date=1343418818]

static access.

depends on the programmer
I hate using statics I do it his way
[/quote]

No it doesn’t. This isn’t something that is stylistic and has little to no change in performance.

Referencing the class by each connected client is not needed at all. Huge memory waster, instead, you could just create a client parameter and make the method static then call it that way. :)[/quote]

private ClassName classname = new ClassName(this); public ClassName getClassName() { return classname; }

is how I do it,
So how would I be able to call the specific class when I need it?
I don’t really get what you mean, but interested in it

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED

[quote=“RandQm, post:19, topic:450887”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=553762.msg4057299#msg4057299 date=1343092852]
static access.
[/quote]
depends on the programmer
I hate using statics I do it his way[/quote]

No it doesn’t. This isn’t something that is stylistic and has little to no change in performance.

Referencing the class by each connected client is not needed at all. Huge memory waster, instead, you could just create a client parameter and make the method static then call it that way.

item.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:8, topic:450887”]Few tips:

	public Miscellaneous Miscellaneous = new Miscellaneous(this);
	public WeaponAnims WeaponAnims = new WeaponAnims(this);
	public Combat Combat = new Combat(this);
	public Range Range = new Range(this);
	public NpcCombat NpcCombat = new NpcCombat(this);
	public Magic Magic = new Magic(this);
	public Level Level = new Level(this);
	public FirstClickNPC FirstClickNPC = new FirstClickNPC(this);
	public SecondClickNPC SecondClickNPC = new SecondClickNPC(this);
	public Crafting Crafting = new Crafting(this);
	public Frames Frames = new Frames(this);
	public Prayer Prayer = new Prayer(this);
	public Drophandler Drophandler = new Drophandler(this);
	public MusicHandler Music = new MusicHandler(this);
	public ServerProcessing ServProcess = new ServerProcessing(this);
	public Doors Doors = new Doors(this);
	public Commands Commands = new Commands();
	public Pickables Pickables = new Pickables(this);
	public Writing write = new Writing(this);
	public Travelling travel = new Travelling(this);
	public DiedHandler died = new DiedHandler(this);
	public Flour flour = new Flour(this);
	public Clipping clip = new Clipping(this);
	public Dialogue Dialogue = new Dialogue(this);
	public Stairs stairs = new Stairs(this);

None of that needs to be referenced by client, it’s just wasting memory.[/quote]

What’s a better solution then?

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Extremely cleaned Delta 2.1 - UPDATED
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Few tips:

	public Miscellaneous Miscellaneous = new Miscellaneous(this);
	public WeaponAnims WeaponAnims = new WeaponAnims(this);
	public Combat Combat = new Combat(this);
	public Range Range = new Range(this);
	public NpcCombat NpcCombat = new NpcCombat(this);
	public Magic Magic = new Magic(this);
	public Level Level = new Level(this);
	public FirstClickNPC FirstClickNPC = new FirstClickNPC(this);
	public SecondClickNPC SecondClickNPC = new SecondClickNPC(this);
	public Crafting Crafting = new Crafting(this);
	public Frames Frames = new Frames(this);
	public Prayer Prayer = new Prayer(this);
	public Drophandler Drophandler = new Drophandler(this);
	public MusicHandler Music = new MusicHandler(this);
	public ServerProcessing ServProcess = new ServerProcessing(this);
	public Doors Doors = new Doors(this);
	public Commands Commands = new Commands();
	public Pickables Pickables = new Pickables(this);
	public Writing write = new Writing(this);
	public Travelling travel = new Travelling(this);
	public DiedHandler died = new DiedHandler(this);
	public Flour flour = new Flour(this);
	public Clipping clip = new Clipping(this);
	public Dialogue Dialogue = new Dialogue(this);
	public Stairs stairs = new Stairs(this);

None of that needs to be referenced by client, it’s just wasting memory.

the process class is unneeded.

Why are you calling this every cycle?

    System.gc();
    System.runFinalization();

The frames class should also go along with your packets, as they are packets.

	public void updatePlayerNames() {
		playerCount = 0;
		for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayers; i++) {
			if (players[i] != null) {
				playersCurrentlyOn[i] = players[i].playerName;
				playerCount++;
			} else
				playersCurrentlyOn[i] = "";
		}
	}

Uh? What’s the point of this other than to call it for no reason every cycle?

	public MD5(String inStr) {
		this.inStr = inStr;
		try {
			md5 = MessageDigest.getInstance("MD5");
		} catch (Exception e) {
			System.out.println(e.toString());
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

	public String compute() {

		char[] charArray = inStr.toCharArray();

		byte[] byteArray = new byte[charArray.length];

		for (int i = 0; i < charArray.length; i++)
			byteArray[i] = (byte) charArray[i];

		byte[] md5Bytes = md5.digest(byteArray);

		StringBuffer hexValue = new StringBuffer();

		for (byte element : md5Bytes) {
			int val = (element) & 0xff;
			if (val < 16)
				hexValue.append("0");
			hexValue.append(Integer.toHexString(val));
		}

		return hexValue.toString();
	}

lol

Naming, and packaging is horrid.

That’s all for now.

Read full topic
